text:
:sunny: Hi folks! As you will have seen, the R Project is participating in Outreachy this year. Hopefully we can give a warm welcome when candidates start contributing in mid-March to mid-April and during the internship period (May-August).

Meanwhile, if anyone is interested in (co-)mentoring an intern or proposing a project, we have till March 23 (<https://www.outreachy.org/communities/cfp/the-r-project-for-statistical-computing/>). We have some ideas under discussion, but welcome others to join in! You can DM me to discuss futher, or email on <mailto:heather@r-project.org|heather@r-project.org>.

elements.text:
Hi folks! As you will have seen, the R Project is participating in Outreachy this year. Hopefully we can give a warm welcome when candidates start contributing in mid-March to mid-April and during the internship period (May-August).

Meanwhile, if anyone is interested in (co-)mentoring an intern or proposing a project, we have till March 23 (
). We have some ideas under discussion, but welcome others to join in! You can DM me to discuss futher, or email on

text: Summary of current proposals in the pipeline: <https://github.com/r-devel/rcontribution/issues/15#issuecomment-1050684123> - note we particularly welcome anyone interested in mentoring a project related to translations.

attachments.text:
Our community application is submitted and pending approval: <https://www.outreachy.org/communities/cfp/the-r-project-for-statistical-computing/|https://www.outreachy.org/communities/cfp/the-r-project-for-statistical-computing/>.

We have till March 23 for mentors to propose projects.

Current plans:

• A project on triaging bugs (<https://github.com/gmbecker|@gmbecker> as proposing mentor)
• A project on converting R Journal articles and/or packages vignettes to HTML (me as proposing mentor)
• A Bioconductor project (proposing mentor TBD)

We also have some tentative ideas around translations (standardize and improve the translatability of the English messages, or translating messages in a language that is not well covered, or creating a dashboard to summarise translation status). However this area is not such a good match to available mentors - if anyone would like to volunteer, do let me know!
attachments.title: <https://github.com/r-devel/rcontribution/issues/15#issuecomment-1050684123|Comment on #15 Outreachy internships>

elements.text: Summary of current proposals in the pipeline:
- note we particularly welcome anyone interested in mentoring a project related to translations.
